title: How to Give Your Hair Volume (for Men)

steps.title: Wash your hair regularly.
steps.content: Wash your hair regularly. Your hair looks and feels its best when you wash it regularly, or whenever it is dirty. Washing it removes oil buildup and styling product residue that can weigh down your hair and make it look flat instead of voluminous and full. [1] X Research source Focus on your scalp when you wash your hair . Gently massage the shampoo into your scalp to exfoliate it and remove debris. Then, let the shampoo run through the rest of your hair. Tip : Rinse your hair with warm or room-temperature water, as hot water can damage your hair follicles and exacerbate the appearance of thinning hair.

steps.title: Use a thickening shampoo and conditioner to clean your hair.
steps.content: Use a thickening shampoo and conditioner to clean your hair. Thickening or volumizing shampoos and conditioners, like hims Thick Fix , are more lightweight, which helps your hair appear more voluminous. They are also formulated with ingredients that can help increase your hair count and the width of your individual strands. [2] X Research source When you apply conditioner , professional hair stylist Gina Almona advises you to “avoid your roots.” She says putting conditioner on your roots can make them “over oily” and “weigh the hair down.” [3] X Expert Source Gina Almona Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 12 December 2019.

steps.title: Use lightweight and volumizing styling products.
steps.content: Use lightweight and volumizing styling products . Professional hair stylist Sarah Kosakowski says “getting volume is all about the products you use.” She recommends using a “volumizing spray or mousse,” like Paul Mitchell’s Extra-Body Sculpting Foam , and applying it “when your hair is damp.” [4] X Expert Source Sarah Kosakowski Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 3 September 2021. Professional hair stylist Martin Nepton agrees, saying that a volumizing mousse is one of his favorite ways to add volume. [5] X Expert Source Martin Nepton Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 17 November 2020. Mousse is generally preferable to wax or gel-based styling products, as it tends to leave less residue in your hair. As a general rule, the less you feel the product in your hair, the better it is at adding volume. You want your hair to feel flexible and lightweight after applying product. Find a product that works well for your particular look. Try out a few mousses, sprays, pomades, and gels to find a product that you like. Tip : Avoid heavy gels, sprays, waxes, and mousses that promise a long-lasting hold. These products can weigh down your hair, cause it to look matted down and greasy, and make it feel crispy or crunchy.

steps.title: When using product, apply a small amount to the tips of your hair.
steps.content: When using product, apply a small amount to the tips of your hair. The way you apply the styling product to your hair also helps add volume. Apply a dime-sized amount of product to your hands and run them backward through your hair to add lift and body. Just avoid putting the product directly on your roots, as this can cause your hair to clump together and look less voluminous. [6] X Research source Apply more product as needed to achieve the look you want. Just use a small amount at a time, as it’s easier to add more product than it is to remove it. Always follow the instructions on the product to apply it correctly and use the amount recommended on the label. Most manufacturers recommend applying their styling products to damp or moist hair. This helps the product uniformly coat your hair.

steps.title: Use your hands to style your hair.
steps.content: Use your hands to style your hair. Avoid using a comb or brush to apply your styling product, as they can flatten your hair. To add the most volume and texture to your hair, simply use your hands to lift your hair up and style it the way you like. [7] X Research source Combs and brushes also tend to pull and tear at the roots of your hair. This pulling can move your hair in an unusual direction and make your scalp more visible.

steps.title: Blow dry your hair after applying product to add even more volume.
steps.content: Blow dry your hair after applying product to add even more volume. Nepton says, “If you want the maximum volume, you have to blow dry” your hair “the opposite way that you want the hair to fall.” For instance, “if you want the volume when you push your hair back, you're gonna blow dry it forward toward your face.” Blow drying backward helps to “lift the root more” so you have “maximum lift.” [8] X Expert Source Martin Nepton Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 17 November 2020. To achieve the most volume, Almona recommends “drying [your] hair upside down.” She says to simply “put your head over and blow dry.” Then, “when you flip [your hair] back, you're creating volume.” [9] X Expert Source Gina Almona Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 12 December 2019. Protect your hair from heat damage by applying a heat protectant . Then, hold the blow dryer 12 in (30 cm) away from your head and keep it on low heat. Run your fingers through your hair while it’s drying to help it dry more quickly. Dry hair tends to appear more voluminous than wet hair or hair that has been oversaturated with product.

steps.title: Tease your hair with dry shampoo or a sea salt spray.
steps.content: Tease your hair with dry shampoo or a sea salt spray . Professional hair stylist Arthur Sebastian says dry shampoos and salt sprays create “a very natural dry finish on the roots, almost as if the hair is teased.” He recommends “first coating the root of the hair with [the] product.” Then, gently tease your hair by pulling a section of hair straight up and running a comb downward through the back of your hair. [10] X Expert Source Arthur Sebastian Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 29 April 2019. For instance, try Living Proof’s Dry Shampoo or Brickell’s Texturizing Sea Salt Spray Sebastian says “the products will help you use the comb a lot less” so “you don't have to strip the hair texture that much.” [11] X Expert Source Arthur Sebastian Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 29 April 2019. Tip : Apply dry shampoo to your hair in between wash days to help soak up oil and add volume back to your hair.

steps.title: Get your hair trimmed every 2 to 3 months.
steps.content: Get your hair trimmed every 2 to 3 months. Getting your hair regularly trimmed and shaped up helps keep your tresses healthy . Sebastian recommends getting regular trims to prevent your hair from reaching the “split end stage,” where “the ends split…into two” strands. He says this helps “the hair to grow a little bit longer” and keeps the ends nourished. [12] X Expert Source Arthur Sebastian Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 29 April 2019. Split ends can also lead to hair breakage and damage, which can prevent your hair from looking healthy and full.

steps.title: Change up your hairstyle to find a volumizing look that suits you.
steps.content: Change up your hairstyle to find a volumizing look that suits you. For example, style your hair into a quiff or faux hawk . Or, add volumizing layers to your hair. Even consider growing out your hair, as the extra length gives you more hair to style and volumize. [13] X Research source If you have naturally curly or wavy hair, try breaking up the curls and waves with your fingers to give your hair as much volume as possible. Separate each curl 2 to 4 times to make your hair appear fuller. If you’re experiencing hairline recession, there are lots of stylish haircuts that can help conceal thinning and make your hair appear fuller.

steps.title: Use hot tools and chemical treatments sparingly.
steps.content: Use hot tools and chemical treatments sparingly. Heat from hot tools like dryers, flat irons, and curlers can damage your hair. Heat damage can cause your hair to look less healthy and promote more breakage and hair loss. The harsh chemicals used in bleaches, perms, and keratin treatments can also lead to hair damage and make your hair appear less healthy, full, and voluminous. [14] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Almona recommends you always use a thermal protectant before using hot tools to “protect the hair from the heat.” [15] X Expert Source Gina Almona Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 12 December 2019. If your hair feels dry, brittle, or damaged, treat it with a deep conditioner or hair mask . Applying a deep conditioner helps add nutrients and moisture back to your hair. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Sleep on a silk pillowcase.
steps.content: Sleep on a silk pillowcase . Silk is a finer, smoother fabric than cotton and other textiles. These qualities help to reduce friction and tugging on your hair as you sleep, lessening potential damage. As a bonus, silk pillowcases also help reduce frizziness. [17] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source Consider sleeping on silk sheets , too!

steps.title: Avoid wearing tight hairstyles and accessories, like hats.
steps.content: Avoid wearing tight hairstyles and accessories, like hats. Pulling your hair into tight ponytails or braids can lead to breakage and hair loss, making your hair appear less full and voluminous. Wearing a tight baseball cap or hat on a daily basis can also compress your hair and reduce its volume. In some cases, it can even damage your hair follicles and reduce circulation to your scalp, impacting your hair thickness and health. [18] X Research source If you’re going to put your hair up, make your ponytail or braid very loose. Sebastian also recommends using soft hair ties instead of rubber bands, as “hair gets broken by the tightness or the pressure of the rubber band.” [19] X Expert Source Arthur Sebastian Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 29 April 2019. Tip : In general, be very gentle with your hair. Do not harshly brush, pull, scrub, or dry your hair to help minimize damage and breakage.

steps.title: Protect your hair and scalp from the sun.
steps.content: Protect your hair and scalp from the sun. The sun’s harsh rays can damage your hair and scalp, causing dryness, split ends, breakage, and even thinning. If you’re going to be out in the sun, apply regular sunscreen on your scalp and wear a wide-brimmed hat. Protect the ends of your hair with hair sunscreen , too. [20] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Sebastian says that “hair is keratin, just like your skin and your nails. So your hair will be weathered just like your face if you're spending a lot of time in the sun.” He explains that “you want to keep [your hair] nourished” and “away from the sun” to maintain its volume and health. [21] X Expert Source Arthur Sebastian Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 29 April 2019.

steps.title: Consider using a hair-growth product, like minoxidil.
steps.content: Consider using a hair-growth product, like minoxidil . If your hair is losing volume due to thinning, a hair growth medication may be the most effective way to restore fullness . Talk to your doctor to see what is causing your hair loss and what products can help you. For instance, your doctor might recommend you use minoxidil (Rogaine) or finasteride (Propecia), both of which can help treat male-pattern baldness. [22] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source Minoxidil is a topical treatment, and finasteride comes in pill form. It is important to note that both of these products have better success rates at stopping hair loss than they do at regrowing lost hair. Be proactive and consult your doctor as soon as you notice your hair is starting to thin. To improve your general hair health, professional hair stylist Jenny Tran recommends taking biotin supplements , eating a healthy, balanced diet, and drinking plenty of water. [23] X Expert Source Jenny Tran Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 19 May 2020.

steps.title: Volume refers to how dense and thick your hair appears.
steps.content: Volume refers to how dense and thick your hair appears. The more hair you have on your head, the more voluminous your hair looks. The diameter of each hair strand also impacts volume, with wider strands helping your hair appear fuller. Your hair texture and hair health also influence volume: Thick, curly hair naturally has more volume and bounce than fine, straight hair. Hair that is more resistant to breakage and split ends typically appears more voluminous and healthy.

steps.title: Hair loss, oiliness, product use, and hair type can diminish volume.
steps.content: Hair loss, oiliness, product use, and hair type can diminish volume. Guys who are experiencing hair thinning or loss often appear to have less volume because they have less hair on their heads. Hair that’s oily and full of product residue can also weigh down hair, making it look flat. Additionally, fine, straight hair tends to appear more flat compared to curly and wavy hair. [24] X Research source Some people naturally have more oily hair than others, so they may need to wash their hair more often so it appears voluminous. Your hair type, age, and ethnicity influence whether your hair is more oily or dry. [25] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Touching your hair often can make it appear greasy, too. Heavy products can also weigh down your hair, so ensure you’re using lightweight, volumizing products to style your hair. Eating well can also influence volume, as eating a balanced diet helps improve hair health. [26] X Research source Luckily, the tips above can help you add volume and body to your hair!
